intro: Allodape americana, commonly known as the American leafcutter bee, is a solitary bee species native to North America. It is characterized by its metallic green body and distinctive black markings. This bee is known for its unique behavior of cutting and transporting leaf fragments to line its nests. The plant-related aspect of Allodape americana involves its reliance on flowering plants for nectar and pollen. Its foraging habits contribute to the pollination of various crops and wild plants.
